abstract.p: Lambeth Council of London grants permission for weddings to be conducted in enclosed glass capsules of giant London Eye Ferris Wheel on River Thames, beginning in 2001 (S)

block.p: Marriage has its ups and downs, so what better place to be married than on the London Eye, the 450-foot-high Ferris wheel on the Thames? The Lambeth Council of London recently granted permission for weddings to be conducted in the enclosed glass capsules of the giant wheel, and it is hoped that the first knots can be tied in 2001. Afterward, couples can have their receptions in nearby County Hall, opposite the Houses of Parliament. Fees for the ceremony and prices for receptions have not been determined. Written applications should be sent to British Airways London Eye, Riverside Building, County Hall, Westminster Bridge Road, London, England SE1 7PB.
